item.name: topology
item.desc: Definitions of molecules, segments, and fragments.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.name
item.desc: Name of the molecule in the coarse-grained model.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.ident
item.desc: Name (identification) of the molecule in the all-atom representation. This must match the molecule name in the atomistic representation.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments
item.desc: Partitioning of the molecule on conjugated segments.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.name
item.desc: Name of a conjugated segment in a molecule.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments
item.desc: Container for all fragments in a segment.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments.fragment.name
item.desc: Name of the rigid fragment in a conjugated segment

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments.fragment.mdatoms
item.desc: List of all atoms belonging to the rigid fragment in the format residue number:atom name:atom number

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments.fragment.qmatoms
item.desc: List of atoms of the rigid fragment in its ground state geometry, atom number:atom type.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments.fragment.weights
item.desc: Weights are used to determine the fragment center. The order should be the same as in the mdatoms and qmatoms definitions. If the mass of a nucleus in atomic mass units is used, the center of the rigid fragment will be its center of mass.

item.name: topology.molecules.molecule.segments.segment.fragments.fragment.localframe
item.desc: Three atoms which define a local frame for each rigid fragment.
